item.title: 美国威胁就数字税报复欧盟公司
item.description: 特朗普政府威胁要对欧盟进行报复，以回应欧盟对美国科技公司征税的努力，并挑出包括埃森哲公司（Accenture Plc）、西门子公司（Siemens AG）和 Spotify Technology SA 在内的知名公司作为可能实施新限制或征收新费用的目标。【原文：The Trump administration threatened retaliation against the European Union in response to efforts to tax American tech companies, singling out prominent companies, including Accenture Plc, Siemens AG and Spotify Technology SA, as possible targets for new restrictions or fees.】

item.title: OpenAI 的 ChatGPT 已更新，可更好更快地生成图像
item.description: OpenAI正在推出ChatGPT的更新版本，旨在更好更快地生成图片，这是该人工智能开发商在与Alphabet公司旗下谷歌的激烈竞争中加强其旗舰聊天机器人的最新举措。 ChatGPT Images 的新版本于本周四发布，旨在更精确地制作和编辑图片，其生成图片的速度比之前的人工智能图片生成模型快四倍。该公司还创建了一个新的板块【原文：OpenAI is rolling out an update to ChatGPT that’s intended to generate images better and faster, the latest move by the artificial intelligence developer to bolster its flagship chatbot amid heated competition from Alphabet Inc.’s Google. item.title: 加拿大央行审查 "更易受冲击的世界 "框架
item.description: 加拿大央行行长蒂夫-马克莱姆（Tiff Macklem）表示，加拿大央行明年对其框架的审查必须评估该框架是否能让央行在一个 "更容易受到冲击的世界 "中保持低通胀和稳定的最佳机会。【原文：Governor Tiff Macklem says the Bank of Canada’s review of its framework next year must assess whether it gives the central bank the best chance of keeping inflation low and stable in a “more shock-prone world.”】

item.title: DoorDash 测试人工智能社交应用，帮助用户寻找餐厅
item.description: DoorDash 公司正在尝试推出一款由人工智能驱动的独立应用程序，供用户寻找新餐馆，从而将其业务范围扩展到旗舰食品配送服务之外。【原文：DoorDash Inc. is experimenting with a standalone artificial intelligence-powered app for users to find new restaurants, expanding its reach beyond its flagship food-delivery service.】

item.title: 康斯伯格以未披露金额收购美国导弹公司 Zone 5
item.description: 挪威防务公司康斯伯格集团（Kongsberg Gruppen ASA）签署协议，收购美国导弹公司Zone 5 Technologies LLC，该公司生产远程攻击和反无人机导弹，收购金额未披露。【原文：Norwegian defense company Kongsberg Gruppen ASA signed an agreement to buy US missile company Zone 5 Technologies LLC, which produces long-range strike and anti-drone missiles, for an undisclosed sum.】

item.title: 石油大亨的超级游艇在制裁前几天离开法国海岸
item.description: 据熟悉此事的人士和彭博社汇编的船舶跟踪数据显示，穆尔塔扎-拉卡尼（Murtaza Lakhani）拥有的一艘超级游艇上周末从法国里维埃拉出发，而此时距离这位巴基斯坦贸易大亨被欧盟制裁仅有几天时间。【原文：A superyacht owned by Murtaza Lakhani departed from the French Riviera late last week, just days before the Pakistani trading tycoon was sanctioned by the European Union, according to people familiar with the matter and ship tracking data compiled by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 船只被扣押后，前往委内瑞拉的舰队转身离去
item.description: 四艘超级油轮组成的舰队原本驶往委内瑞拉，但在加勒比海水域扣押了一艘受制裁的油轮后改变了航向。【原文：An armada of four supertankers originally headed for Venezuela have reversed course following the seizure of a sanctioned tanker in Caribbean waters.】

item.title: 阿尔伯塔省 1,330 亿美元养老金任命 Ray Gilmour 为永久首席执行官
item.description: 阿尔伯塔省投资管理公司任命雷-吉尔莫（Ray Gilmour）为永久首席执行官，一年多前，加拿大阿尔伯塔省政府解雇了他的前任和董事会，吉尔莫被临时任命为首席执行官。【原文：Alberta Investment Management Corp. appointed Ray Gilmour as permanent chief executive officer, more than a year after he took the role on an interim basis when the government of the Canadian province fired his predecessor and the board.】

item.title: 亚马逊利用摩根大通支持的初创公司为网络卖家提供贷款
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）正与摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Amazon.com Inc. is partnering with a JPMorgan Chase & Co.-backed startup to provide financing for small online businesses, many of which need immediate capital to replenish depleted holiday inventories.】

item.title: Instagram 首次推出亚马逊 Fire TV 专用电视应用程序
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. 旗下的 Instagram 推出了首款专用电视应用程序，让用户可以在更大的屏幕上观看短视频功能 Reels。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc.’s Instagram unveiled its first dedicated TV app, which lets users watch the short-form video feature Reels on a larger screen.】

item.title: Perplexity AI 对 iPad 应用程序进行改版，深化对研究工具的关注
item.description: Perplexity AI 公司正在重新推出 iPad 应用程序，其功能包括改进多任务处理和强调研究工具，这是这家人工智能搜索初创公司为争取商业客户而做出的更大努力的一部分。【原文：Perplexity AI Inc. is relaunching its iPad app with features that include improved multitasking and an emphasis on research tools, part of a larger effort by the artificial intelligence search startup to court business customers.】

item.title: 美国石油期货自 2021 年以来首次跌破每桶 55 美元
item.description: 西德克萨斯中质油自 2021 年 2 月以来首次跌破每桶 55 美元，这是原油供应超过需求的最新迹象，市场正在为大量过剩做好准备。【原文：West Texas Intermediate oil fell below $55 a barrel for the first time since February 2021, the latest sign that crude supplies are outpacing demand as the market braces for a large surplus.】

item.title: 美国联邦存款保险公司将公布银行如何申请发行稳定币的计划
item.description: 美国联邦存款保险公司（Federal Deposit Insurance Corp.）正在提出一个框架，概述银行如何通过子公司申请发行支付稳定币，这是该机构为实施具有里程碑意义的立法而迈出的关键性的第一步。【原文：The Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. is proposing a framework that outlines how banks would be able to apply to issue payment stablecoins via a subsidiary, a key first step from the agency towards implementing landmark legislation.】

item.title: Pimco 为新资产融资战略筹集 70 亿美元资金
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，太平洋投资管理公司（Pacific Investment Management Co.【原文：Pacific Investment Management Co. raised more than $7 billion for an asset-based finance strategy, including its first funds designed exclusively for insurance companies and wealthy individuals, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国生物技术股票销售额创 2021 年以来最大季度纪录
item.description: 美国上市生物技术和制药公司的股票销售在年末开始复苏，因为行业内的并购提高了估值，刺激了更多需求。【原文：US-listed biotechnology and pharmaceutical company share sales are staging a late-year revival, as mergers and acquisitions in the industry boost valuations and stoke additional demand.】

item.title: 就业数据未能刺激降息预期，美国股市下跌
item.description: 美国股市周二下跌，原因是就业市场低迷的迹象并未改变美联储降息的前景。【原文：US stocks fell on Tuesday as signs of a sluggish job market didn’t change the outlook for interest-rate cuts from the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 高盛和摩根大通在新时代销售复杂的加密货币产品
item.description: 比特币曾一度被认为太不稳定、太不规范、太边缘化，不适合华尔街知名企业打包出售给富裕客户的金融工具。现在不再是了。【原文：Bitcoin was once considered too volatile, too unregulated, and too fringe for the kinds of financial instruments that respectable Wall Street firms package up and sell to wealthy clients. No longer.】

item.title: 信心危机 "之后，美联储流动性工具重塑品牌形象
item.description: 华尔街策略师表示，由于一个关键的融资机制效率低下，美联储上周被迫迅速从缩减资产负债表转向向金融系统增加流动性。【原文：The Federal Reserve was forced to quickly pivot from shrinking its balance sheet to adding liquidity back to the financial system last week because of inefficiencies in a key funding facility, Wall Street strategists said.】

item.title: 据说 Luckin Coffee 考虑竞购雀巢旗下的蓝瓶咖啡
item.description: 据知情人士透露，中国的乐金咖啡公司正在考虑竞购雀巢公司旗下的蓝瓶咖啡，以提升其品牌形象并拓展高端咖啡市场。【原文：China’s Luckin Coffee Inc. is considering making a bid for Nestle SA’s Blue Bottle Coffee to boost its brand profile and expand in the premium coffee segment, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 美国商业活动增长放缓，价格压力增大
item.description: 美国 12 月份的商业活动扩张速度为六个月来最慢，而衡量投入品价格的指标则跃升至三年多来的新高。【原文：US business activity expanded in December at the slowest pace in six months, while a measure of input prices jumped to a more than three-year high.】

item.title: 以下是美国月度就业报告的主要内容

item.title: 比特币进入疲劳期，代币将迎来第四次年度亏损
item.description: 比特币正走向其历史上的第四次年度下跌，这也是第一次没有与重大丑闻或行业崩溃同时发生。【原文：Bitcoin is headed for the fourth annual decline in its history, and the first one that didn’t coincide with a major scandal or industry meltdown.】

item.title: 博德之门 3》制作人承诺《神界》将 "更上一层楼
item.description: Larian 首席执行官 Vincke 说："我认为这款游戏会比《博德之门 3》好得多。【原文：‘I think this one is going to be way better’ than ‘Baldur’s Gate 3,’ Larian CEO Vincke says】

item.title: 美国失业率超预期后，国债出现波动
item.description: 美国 11 月失业率超出预期，增强了美联储 2026 年进一步降息的预期，国债走高。【原文：Treasuries edged higher after the US November unemployment rate exceeded estimates, bolstering expectations for further Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts in 2026.】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司推迟支付 250 万英镑的管理人员奖金
item.description: 泰晤士水务公司（Thames Water）本月推迟向高级管理人员支付近 250 万英镑（约合 340 万美元）的奖金，以应对在该公司被评为英国污染最严重的供应商之一时不奖励员工的压力。【原文：Thames Water has deferred payment of almost £2.5 million ($3.4 million) in bonuses to its senior managers this month bowing to pressure not to reward staff while the company is ranked among the worst-polluting suppliers in the UK.】

item.title: Glencore 通过收购项目增强秘鲁铜业实力
item.description: Glencore Plc 收购了秘鲁现有采矿业务附近的一个项目，从而加强了其在秘鲁的地位，这也是该公司全球铜矿扩张战略的一部分。【原文：Glencore Plc is strengthening its position in Peru with the purchase of a project near its existing mining operations, part of the company’s global copper expansion strategy.】

item.title: 美国 10 月就业人数减少 64,000 人，失业率上升
item.description: 美国 11 月份的就业增长依然疲软，失业率升至四年来的新高，表明劳动力市场在经历了 10 月份的疲软之后继续降温。【原文：US job growth remained sluggish in November and the unemployment rate rose to a four-year high, pointing to a continued cooling in the labor market after a weak October.】

item.title: 美国零售销售因汽车购买量下降而停滞不前
item.description: 美国 10 月份的零售额变化不大，原因是汽车经销商的销售额下降，汽油收入减少，抵消了其他类别消费的增长。【原文：US retail sales were little changed in October as a decline at auto dealers and weaker gasoline receipts offset stronger spending in other categories.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利郑永年：科技带来 "多年 "并购繁荣
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）的一位资深银行家表示，在今年创下并购纪录之后，技术交易商们的并购活动才刚刚开始。【原文：Technology dealmakers are just beginning a supercharged period of mergers and acquisitions activity after racking up a record run this year, according to a senior Morgan Stanley banker.】

item.title: Databricks 以 1,340 亿美元估值融资 40 多亿美元
item.description: Databricks 在新一轮融资中筹集了 40 多亿美元，这家私营软件公司的估值达到 1,340 亿美元。【原文：Databricks is raising over $4 billion in a new funding round that values the private software firm at $134 billion.】
